channel.title: Jul
channel.description: Day By Day VA Family-Literacy Calendar

item.title: July Monthly Activities
item.description:
Books to Read!

• Stinklepus Stinkleby Takes A Bath by Maria Angelini and Stephanie Angelini
• Giraffes Don't Take Baths by Ronda Sarner Anderson and Travis Ridley
• Wash Your Hands! by Tony Ross
• Don't Behave Like You Live In A Cave by Elizabeth Verdick
• Gregory, The Terrible Eater by Mitchell Sharmat, Jose Aruego, and Ariane Dewey
• Summer by Alice Low and Roy McKie
• The Night Before Summer Vacation by Natasha Wing and Julie Durrell
• Summer Days and Nights by Wong Herbert Yee
• The Wildest Summer Ever by AIO Team
• I See Summer by Charles Ghigna and Ag Jatkowska
• Summer Jackson: Grow Up by Teresa E. Harris
• Andi's Indian Summer by Susan K. Marlow and Leslie Gammmelgaard
• Zoomer's Summer Snowstorm by Ned Young
• Best Friends In Fairyland by Daisy Meadows
• Ollie the Stomper by Olivier Dunrea
• Ladybug Girl Makes Friends by Jacky Davis and David Soman
• What's the Recipe for Friends? by Greg M. Williamson and Greg Abele
• Day Dreamers: A Journey of Imagination by Emily Martin
• Good Morning, Sunshine! by Sandra Magsamen
• Mimi Make Believe by Claire Freedman and Gemma Raynor
• The Magic Hat by Mem Fox and Tricia Tusa
• Sylvester and the Magic Pebble by William Steig
• Pete the Cat and His Magic Sunglasses by James Dean and Kimberly Dean
• You Are Not Small by Anna Kang and Christopher Weyant
• Ernest, The Moose Who Doesn't Fit by Catherine Rayner
• Shapeasaurus by Megan E. Bryant and Luciana Navarro Powell
• Just A Little Bit by Ann Tompert and Lynn Munsinger
• Who Sank the Boat? by Pamela Allen
• Original Recipe by Jessica Young and Jessica Secheret
• Monster Knows Shapes by Lori Capote, Chip Wass, Laura Purdie Salas, and Terry Flaherty

Artwork by Dewdney iREAD 2014 Summer Reading Program

Around VA

Check out Festivals and Events happening in July around the state.

  • 2015 First Friday Summer Art Walk - Martinsville
  • Celebrate Freedom - Chesapeake
  • Celebrate America - Manassas
  • 4th of July Great American Picnic and Fireworks - Norfolk
  • Wytheville Summer Farmers Market - Wytheville
  • 2015 Fishersville Indoor Market and Yard Sale - Fishersville
  • Herndon 4th of July Celebration - Herndon
  • Vienna July 4th Festival and Fireworks Show - Vienna
  • Norfolk Harborfest - Norfolk
  • Caroline County Agricultural Fair - Ruther Glen
  • Summer Brewfest - Norfolk
  • Artful Flea Outdoor Yard Sale - Chincoteague Island
  • Madison County Fair - Madison
  • Mineral Bluegrass Festival - Mineral
  • Hungry Mother Arts and Crafts Festival - Marion
  • Norfolk Jazz Festival - Norfolk
  • Virginia Beach Summer Town Fair - Virginia Beach
  • Virginia Lake Festival - Clarksville
  • Salem Summer Gun and Knife Show - Salem
  • Chantilly Summer Big Flea Market - Chantilly
  • Hampton Summer Gun Show - Hampton
  • Floydfest - Floyd
  • Chincoteague Blueberry Festival - Chincoteague
  • Mid-Summer Fantasy Festival Performance Art and Theater In the Park - Norfolk
  • Chantilly Summer Gun and Knife Show - Chantilly
  • Deltaville Summer Farmers Market - Deltaville
  • Virginia Highlands Festival - Abingdon
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 31
item.description:
Sing a Song

My Pigeon House

My pigeon house, I open wide,
Open wide and set all my pigeons free.
They fly all around
And up, and down,
And up, and down,
And light in the tallest tree.
And when they return from their merry, merry flight,
They close their eyes and say "Good night"¬ù
Coo-coo-coo-coo
Coo-ooh-coo-ooh-ooh-ohh
Good night!

Watch

These Are My Glasses

Try This

Play Freeze! Dance to music and then have a parent or designated child yell "FREEZE." Everyone should stop and hold the position they are in.

TumbleBooks

Oh Crumps! - Lee Bock

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • New York Philharmonic Kidzone - This site has games, information, music clips and more for the budding musician.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 30
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Grand Old Duke of York

The grand old duke of York
He had ten thousand men
He marched them up to the top of the hill
And he marched them down again
And when they were up they were up
And when they were down they were down
And when they were only half-way up
They were neither up nor down!

Actions: Every time you sing the word "up", stand up. When you sing the word "down", sit down. On "half-way up", stand up with knees bent. Repeat the song a number of times, getting faster. Or, try reversing the actions (e.g. sit down on "up", stand up on "down"!)

Watch

Blackbeard, Bluebeard, and Redbeard

Try This

Make your own band!

Help your child turn over paper plates and play them with straws as drums. Use the paper plate rattles from earlier in the month. Make rhythm sticks with paper towel or toilet paper holders, tape, and beans or pasta.

TumbleBooks

The Paper Bag Princess - Robert Munsch

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Pirate Hat - All you need is old newspaper to make the perfect pirate hat!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 29
item.description:
Sing a Song

Rub-a-dub-dub

Rub-a-dub-dub,
Three men in a tub,
And how do you think they got there?
The butcher, the baker,
The candlestick-maker,
They all jumped out of a rotten potato,
'Twas enough to make a man stare.

TumbleBooks

Into the Tub - Laura J. Beaver and Jill P. Nolen

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

During bathtime sing the song Where is Thumbkin? together. Follow Thumbkin with Pointer, Longman, Ringman, and Pinkie. Then sing This Little Piggy for your child's toes.

Watch

Kids Bathe with Rubber Duckie

Explore More

  • Bath Tub Art - Make tub paints that make bath time an art extravaganza!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 28
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Bees' Party

The bees gave a party and invited all they knew
The wasps and the hornets and a few mosquitoes, too
Yo-ho, and hey! every orchard tree was humming with a
buzz-buzz-buzz
On that sunny summer day.

The bees said, "Good-day, and won't you make yourself at home?"¬ù
The band played sweet music, which it made upon a comb
A lovely scene was that happy party, gaily singing
buzz-buzz-buzz
As they danced upon the green.

Miss Wasp asked the Bumblebee if he would sing a song
She said they would listen if it wasn't very long
The bee said, "Oh, very gladly I will sing for you, but
hum-sweet-hum
Is the only tune I know."¬ù

The hours passed too quickly and the day was too-soon sped
The wasps and the hornets said "good-night"¬ù and went to bed
But ho! and hey! the mosquitoes never stopped their singing
buzz-buzz-buzz
'Til the dawning of the day.

Watch

Instruments of the Orchestra

Try This

Introduce your child to jazz and classical music today. Have him or her tell you what he or she is thinking about during the music.

TumbleBooks

50 Below Zero - Robert Munsch

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Interactive Orchestra - Learn about each section of the orchestra and listen to music samples!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 27
item.description:
Sing a Song

Wiggly Woo

There's a worm at the bottom of the garden
And his name is Wiggly Woo
There's a worm at the bottom of the garden
And all that he can do
Is wiggle all night
And wiggle all day
Whatever else the people do say
There's a worm at the bottom of the garden
And his name is Wiggly Woo

TumbleBooks

Dad Runs Away With the Circus - Edgar Keret

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Kids get to choose the music today. Have them tell you why they are picking the music.

Watch

Curious George Digs Worms

Explore More

  • Caillou’s Magic Keyboard - Here is a keyboard you can play online.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 26
item.description:
Sing a Song

Take Me Out to the Forest

Tune: Take Me Out to the Ball Game

Take me out to the forest
Let me hike in the wild.
Show me a skunk and a few bear tracks.
I won't care if I never come back.
But it's look, look, look at your compass.
If it rains, then it pours.
And it's ouch, slap, sting and you’re bit
In the great outdoors!

Watch

The Freeze Dance Song

Try This

Everyone dance to beach music. Does anyone in your family know how to dance the Shag?

TumbleBooks

Dinosailors - Deb Lund

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Make a Dancing Balloon! - You can make a balloon wiggle and jiggle! Please keep the balloon away from very young children.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 25
item.description:
Sing a Song

Down By the Station

Down by the station
Early in the morning
See the little puffer bellies
All in a row.
See the stationmaster
Pull the little handle
Chug! Chug! Whoo! Whoo!
Off we go!

TumbleBooks

Matthew and the Midnight Tow Truck - Allen Morgan

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Make a song grab bag! Write or make pictures of your family’s favorite songs and then put them in a bag or box (tissue boxes work great!). Next time you need inspiration, pick a song from the grab bag for a sing-along session.

Watch

The Mat and the Mitten

Explore More

  • Whistle & Peep - Can you pick which train made the whistle?
  • Tissue Box Guitar - Here is another great guitar to make and play!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 24
item.description:
Sing a Song

Polly Wolly Doodle

Oh, I went down South for to see my Sal
singing Polly wolly doodle all the day
my Sal, she am a spunky gal
sing Polly wolly doodle all the day

Fare thee well, fare thee well,
fare thee well my fairy Fay
for I'm off to Lou'siana for to see my Susyanna
sing Polly wolly doodle all the day

Oh, my Sal, she is a maiden fair
sing Polly wolly doodle all the day
with curly eyes and laughing hair
sing Polly wolly doodle all the day

Fare thee well, fare thee well,
fare thee well my fairy Fay
for I'm off to Lou'siana for to see my Susyanna
sing Polly wolly doodle all the day

Oh I like watermelon and I have for years
sing Polly wolly doodle all the day
I eat watermelon because it gets upon my ears
sing Polly wolly doodle all the day

TumbleBooks

Zoe Sophia's Scrapbook - Claudia Mauner and Elisa Smalley

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Spend time cooking or baking something. Put on music and listen or sing together.

Watch

Explore More

  • Mega Music Fest Microphone Cupcakes! - Make microphone cupcakes at your next party and let everyone be a singing superstar!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 23
item.description:
Sing a Song

There's a Hole at the Bottom of the Sea

There's a hole at the bottom of the sea.
There's a hole at the bottom of the sea.
There's a hole, there's a hole,
There's a hole at the bottom of the sea.

Now there's a log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
Now there's a log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
There's a log, there's a log,
There's a log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.

Now there's a bump on the log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
Now there's a bump on the log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
There's a bump, there's a bump,
There's a bump at the bottom of the sea.

Now there's a frog on the bump on the log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
Now there's a frog on the bump on the log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
There's a frog, there's a frog,
There's a frog at the bottom of the sea.

Now there's a wart on the frog on the bump on the log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
Now there's a wart on the frog on the bump on the log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
There's a wart, there's a wart,

There's a wart at the bottom of the sea.
Now there's a fly on the wart on the frog . . .
Now there's a fly on the wart on the frog . . .
There's a fly, there's a fly,
There's a fly at the bottom of the sea.

Now there's a wing on the fly on the wart . . .
Now there's a wing on the fly on the wart . . .
There's a wing, there's a wing,
There's a wing at the bottom of the sea.

Now there's a flea on the wing on the fly . . .
Now there's a flea on the wing on the fly . . .
There's a flea, there's a flea,
There's a flea at the bottom of the sea.

Now there's a wing on the flea on the wing . . .
Now there's a wing on the flea on the wing . . .
There's a wing, there's a wing,
There's a wing at the bottom of the sea.

Now there's a speck on the wing on the flea . . .
Now there's a speck on the wing on the flea . . .
There's a speck, there's a speck,
There's a speck at the bottom of the sea.

Now there's a germ on the speck on the wing on the flea on the wing on the fly on the wart on the frog on the bump on the log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
Now there's a germ on the speck on the wing on the flea on the wing on the fly on the wart on the frog on the bump on the log in the hole at the bottom of the sea.
There's a germ, there's a germ,
There's a germ at the bottom of the sea!

Watch

Beethoven’s Wig

Try This

Have you or your child been to a live concert or recital? Talk about jobs where people perform in front of an audience. If you have live music, put it on and listen together.

TumbleBooks

Pecorino's First Concert - Alan Madison

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Canadian Brass Fugue - Listen to a tuba, trumpet, French horn, and other brass instruments.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 22
item.description:
Sing a Song

I am a Fine Musician

I am a fine musician, I travel round the world.
(Clap hands.)
I can play my violin, my violin, my violin.
(Extend one arm for violin; move other hand back and forth across arm.)
I can play my violin, fiddle-dee-dee-da.
I am a fine musician, I travel round the world.
(Clap hands.)
I can blow my trumpet, my trumpet, my trumpet. (Hold fist to mouth and blow.)
I can blow my trumpet, toot-toot-toot-toot-toot.
I am a fine musician, I travel round the world.
(Clap hands.)
I can crash my cymbals, my cymbals, my cymbals. (Brush palms of hands up and down against each other.)
I can crash my cymbals, crash-crash-crash-crash-bang.

TumbleBooks

Yancy and Bear - Hazel Hutchins

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

What in your house can become a musical instrument? Walk around with your child and see what you can find. You can go outside and look too!

Watch

We Are In an Orchestra

Explore More

  • Knowitall Music - Watch the one minute movie on music, make music, and more!
  • Box Guitar - Need a guitar? Make one from a tissue box and rubber bands!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 21
item.description:
Mother Goose Time!

Sing, sing,
What shall I sing?
The cat‚Äôs run away
With the pudding string!
Do, do,
What shall I do?
The Cat‚Äôs run away
With the pudding too!

TumbleBooks

Old Mother Hubbard - illustrated by Brandon Steen

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Play Pat-a-Cake and other clapping rhymes. How many do you know?

Watch

Canta Means Sing in Spanish

Explore More

  • Choir - Make music using only people‚Äôs voices.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 20
item.description:
Sing a Song

Right Hand, Left Hand

This is my right hand,
I’ll raise it up high (right hand over head).
This is my left hand,
I’ll touch the sky (left hand up).
Right hand (show right palm)
Left hand (show left palm)
Roll them around (roll hands over and over)
Left hand (show left palm)
Right hand (show right palm)
Pound, pound, pound (pound fists together)

Watch

Animal Names in Sign Language

Try This

Draw a picture together and have your child sing a song about the picture.

TumbleBooks

Lost and Found, Story 2: Ginger - Jim LaMarche

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Moroccan Khamsa - Make an African good-luck charm!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 19
item.description:
Sing a Song

I Want To Lead a Band

I want to lead a band
With a baton in my hand.
I want to make sweet music high and low.
Now first I'll beat the drum
With a rhythmic tum-tum-tum.
And then I'll play the bells
A-ting-a-ling-a-ling.
And next I'll blow the flute
With a cheery toot-a-toot.
Then I'll make the violin sweetly sing.
Now I'm leading a band
With a baton in my hand.

TumbleBooks

Clever Beatrice - Margaret Willey

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Have everyone in the family march and sing around the house today. Good marching songs include The Noble Duke of York and The Ants Go Marching.

Watch

Sesame Street: Marching Band Mimic

Explore More

  • Bananas in Pyjamas Song Time - Sing along with these catchy tunes!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 18
item.description:
Sing a Song

My Big Blue Boat

I love to row in my big blue boat,
My big blue boat, my big blue boat
I love to row in my big blue boat
Out on the deep blue sea
My big blue boat has two red sails
(wave arms over head like sails)
Two red sails, two red sails
My big blue boat has two red sails
Out on the deep blue sea
So come for a row in my big blue boat
My big blue boat, my big blue boat
So come for a row in a big blue boat
Out on the deep blue sea

TumbleBooks

Once Upon A Breath - Aaron Zevy

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Read books about music, especially ones that might come with an audio CD. Which books do you like best?

Watch

Ruby Sings the Blues

Explore More

  • Make a Musical Instrument - Make a tambourine, drum, cymbals, and more!
  • Musical Instruments to Make at Home - Make a bean shaker, kazoo, and other instruments perfect for a homemade marching band!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 17
item.description:
Sing a Song

Little Seed in the Ground

Little seed in the ground
(Crouch down on the floor, hands covering head)
Sitting so still.
Little seed, will you sprout?
Yes, I will!
(Jump up.)

TumbleBooks

Duck! Rabbit! - Amy Krouse Rosenthal

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Take a walk outside as a family. Do you hear nature’s music? Talk about what you hear.

Watch

PBS Kids: Stomp

Explore More

  • Paper Plate Duck - Here is an easy duck puppet to make. Use it to sing along with songs such as Five Little Ducks.
  • Animal Soundscape - Make a song using animal sounds!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 16
item.description:
I have something in my pocket
That belongs upon my face
I keep it very close at hand
In a most convenient place.

I think you wouldn't guess it
If you guessed a long long while
So I'll take it out and put it on
It's a great big happy smile.

TumbleBooks

Hello Sun - Hans Wilhelm

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Talk together about how you sing in “a round.” Try singing in a round to Row, Row, Row Your Boat.

Row, Row, Row Your Boat

Row, row, row your boat,
Gently down the stream.
Merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily,
Life is but a dream.

Watch

Dance in Smarty Pants

Explore More

  • Brementown Musicians - Listen and watch this classic story of an animal band of musicians.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 15
item.description:
Sing a Song

An Owl Sat Alone

An owl sat alone
(Hold up pointer finger)
On the branch of a tree
He was as quiet as he could be.
( Finger to lips)
It was night
And his eyes were round like this.
(Circle eyes with thumbs and fingers)
And when he looked around
Not a thing did he miss.
(Peer around)

TumbleBooks

Little Hoot - Amy Krouse Rosenthal

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Help your child draw pictures of birds that sing.

Watch

PBS Kids: Dixie Chimps: Goodbye Chick

Explore More

  • Beak Card - Make a pop-up card for a family member. Younger children will need help with cutting.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 14
item.description:
Sing a Song

Good Morning Song

Good Morning, good morning to you.
We're all in our places
With sunshiny faces,
and this is the way
to start a new day!

Good morning to you
Good morning to you
Our day is beginning
There's so much to do
So good morning, good morning, Good morning to you!

Watch

Good Morning Song

Try This

Sing a song to your child in the morning to wake him or her up.

TumbleBooks

Stella the Star - Mark Shulman

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Sun Art - Try one of these art projects (or several!) all about the sun!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 13
item.description:
Sing a Song

I’ve Been Workin’ on the Railroad

I've been workin' on the railroad,
All the live long day.
I've been workin' on the railroad,
Just to pass the time away.
Don't you hear the whistle blowing?
Rise up so early in the morn.
Don't you hear the captain shouting
"Dinah, blow your horn?"

Dinah, won't you blow,
Dinah, won't you blow,
Dinah, won't you blow your horn?
Dinah, won't you blow,
Dinah, won't you blow,
Dinah, won't you blow your horn?

Someone's in the kitchen with Dinah.
Someone's in the kitchen, I know.
Someone's in the kitchen with Dinah
Strumming on the old banjo.

Fee, fie, fiddle-e-i-o.
Fee, fie, fiddle-e-i-o-o-o-o.
Fee, fie, fiddle-e-i-o.
Strumming on the old banjo.

TumbleBooks

You See A Circus. I See… - Mike Downs

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Put on music for your child. Practice dancing or moving fast, then slow. Keep repeating.

KPR: Kids’ Public Radio

Explore More

  • Gullah Music - Sing along with these songs in Gullah, a language from the South Carolina coast.
  • Choo-Choo Train - Everyone can sing along and do the actions for the train.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 12
item.description:
She'll Be Coming 'Round The Mountain When She Comes

She'll be coming 'round the mountain when she comes.
She'll be coming 'round the mountain when she comes.
She'll be coming 'round the mountain,
She'll be coming 'round the mountain,
She'll be coming 'round the mountain when she comes.

She'll be driving six white horses when she comes.
Whoa back!
She'll be driving six white horses when she comes.
Whoa back!
She'll be driving six white horses, she'll be driving six white horses,
She'll be driving six white horses when she comes.
Whoa back!

Oh, we'll all go out to meet her when she comes.
Oh, we'll all go out to meet her when she comes.
Oh, we'll all go out to meet her, we'll all go out to meet her,
We'll all go out to meet her when she comes.

She'll be wearing red pajamas when she comes.
Scratch, scratch.
She'll be wearing red pajamas when she comes.
Scratch, scratch.
She'll be wearing red pajamas, she'll be wearing red pajamas,
She'll be wearing red pajamas when she comes.
Scratch, scratch.

She will have to sleep with Grandma when she comes.
She will have to sleep with Grandma when she comes.
She will have to sleep with Grandma,
She will have to sleep with Grandma,
She will have to sleep with Grandma when she comes.

She'll be coming 'round the mountain when she comes.
She'll be coming 'round the mountain when she comes.
She'll be coming 'round the mountain,
She'll be coming 'round the mountain,
She'll be coming 'round the mountain when she comes.

TumbleBooks

Miss Malarkey Doesn't Live in Room 10 - Judy Finchler

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Sit down and sing The Wheels on the Bus and She‚Äôll Be Coming ‚ÄòRound the Mountain. Do the hand motions.

Watch

The Wheels on the Bus

Explore More

  • Bus Collage - Make a bus and put pictures of yourself and your friends or family in it.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 11
item.description:
This Old Man

Can you make up actions to go with each verse?

This old man, he played one
He played knick-knack on my thumb
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

This old man, he played two
He played knick-knack on my shoe
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

This old man, he played three
He played knick-knack on my knee
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

This old man, he played four
He played knick-knack on my door
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

This old man, he played five
He played knick-knack on my hive
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

This old man, he played six
He played knick-knack on my sticks
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

This old man, he played seven
He played knick-knack up in heaven
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

This old man, he played eight
He played knick-knack on my gate
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

This old man, he played nine
He played knick-knack on my spine
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

This old man, he played ten
He played knick-knack once ag'n
With a knick-knack patty-whack, give a dog a bone
This old man came rolling home

Watch

This Old Man

Try This

With your child, listen for and point out the different kinds of noises you hear today.

TumbleBooks

Doors - Roxie Munro

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Explore More

  • Piano - Play the online piano and then listen to the song again!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 10
item.description:
Sing a Song

Hokey Pokey

You put your right foot in,
You put your right foot out;
You put your right foot in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about!

You put your left foot in,
You put your left foot out;
You put your left foot in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about!

You put your right hand in,
You put your right hand out;
You put your right hand in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about!

You put your left hand in,
You put your left hand out;
You put your left hand in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about!

You put your right side in,
You put your right side out;
You put your right side in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about!

You put your left side in,
You put your left side out;
You put your left side in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about!

You put your nose in,
You put your nose out;
You put your nose in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about!

You put your backside in,
You put your backside out;
You put your backside in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about!

You put your head in,
You put your head out;
You put your head in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about!

You put your whole self in,
You put your whole self out;
You put your whole self in,
And you shake it all about.
You do the Hokey-Pokey,
And you turn yourself around.
That's what it's all about

TumbleBooks

Song Of Middle C - Alison McGhee

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Play musical chairs and feel free to change up the rules to fit how many people you have. If everyone is little, try the Hokey Pokey.

Watch

Fireflies

Explore More

  • Boogie Beats - Make your very own music video.
  • Kitty in the Straw - Ever heard of the folk classic Turkey in the Straw? Now try Kitty in the Straw!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 9
item.description:
Sing a Song

Simple Simon

Simple Simon met a pieman going to the fair;
Said Simple Simon to the pieman "Let me taste your ware"
Said the pieman to Simple Simon "Show me first your penny"
Said Simple Simon to the pieman "Sir, I have not any!"

Simple Simon went a-fishing for to catch a whale;
All the water he had got was in his mother's pail.
Simple Simon went to look if plums grew on a thistle;
He pricked his fingers very much which made poor Simon whistle.
He went for water in a sieve but soon it all fell through;
And now poor Simple Simon bids you all "adieu"

TumbleBooks

Castle On Hester Street - Linda Heller

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

Try This

Visit the library! Pick out books about music and bring home musical CDs.

Watch

Calico Pie

Explore More

  • StoryPlace presents Music - Listen to a story, make a craft, and find more books all about music!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 8
item.description:
Sing a Song

Cradle Song

Golden slumbers kiss your eyes,
Smiles awake you when you rise ;
Sleep, pretty wantons, do not cry,
And I will sing a lullaby,
Rock them, rock them, lullaby.

Care is heavy, therefore sleep you,
You are care, and care must keep you ;
Sleep, pretty wantons, do not cry,
And I will sing a lullaby,
Rock them, rock them, lullaby.

Watch

The Alphabet Song-Signing

Try This

What are you and your child's favorite lullabies? Spend time singing or listening to them.

This book is available online through TumbleBooks. Access is provided by the Library of Virginia and Find It Virginia.

  • AOL Radio: Lullabies - With this radio station, you can always have a lullaby handy for naptime!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 7
item.description:
Sing a Song

Old King Cole

Old King Cole was a merry old soul, and a merry old soul was he;
He called for his pipe in the middle of the night
And he called for his fiddlers three.
Every fiddler had a fine fiddle, and a very fine fiddle had he;
Oh there's none so rare as can compare
With King Cole and his fiddlers three.

Watch

{swfremote}http://www.kneebouncers.com/content/game_music.swf|370|300{/swfremote}

Play pretend instruments together like piano, guitar, flute, and drums.

item.title: July 6
item.description:
Sing a Song

Loop de Loop

Here we go loop de loop
Here we go loop de lie
Here we go loop de loop
All on a Saturday night

You put your right hand in
You take your right hand out
You give your hand a shake, shake, shake
And turn yourself about

Here we go loop de loop
Here we go loop de lie
Here we go loop de loop
All on a Saturday night

For the rest of the lyrics, click here

Watch

Here we Go Looby Loo

item.title: July 5
item.description:
Sing a Song

Frère Jacques

Frère Jacques, Frère Jacques,
Dormez vous? Dormez vous?
Sonnez les matines, Sonnez les matines
Ding Ding Dong, Ding Ding Dong

English Version:
Are you sleeping, are you sleeping?
Brother John, Brother John?
Morning bells are ringing,
morning bells are ringing
Ding Ding Dong, Ding Ding Dong.

Watch

Frere Jacques

Try This

Put on quiet music and show your child how to practice stretching. You can both count quietly as you stretch together.

item.title: July 4
item.description:
Sing a Song

Head, Shoulders, Knees, and Toes

Sing and do the motions for Head, Shoulders, Knees, and Toes. What other songs do you like?

Head and shoulders, knees and toes, knees and toes,
Head and shoulders, knees and toes, knees and toes,
And eyes and ears and mouth and nose,
Head and shoulders, knees and toes, knees and toes.

Ankles, elbows, feet and seat, feet and seat,
Ankles, elbows, feet and seat, feet and seat,
And hair and hips and chin and cheeks,
Ankles, elbows, feet and seat, feet and seat.

Watch

Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes

Try This

Put on any kind of music and find the rhythm. Help your child practice clapping to the beat.

item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: July 3
item.description:
Sing a Song

My Hands

On my head my hands I place.
(Place hands on head)

On my shoulders,
(Place hands on shoulders)

On my face,
(Place hands on face)

On my hips,
(Place hands on hips)

And at my side,
(Drop hands to sides)

Then behind me they will hide,
(Hide hands behind back)

I will hold them up so high,
(Raise hands high above head)

Quickly make my fingers fly,
(Wiggle fingers)

Hold them out in front of me,
(Hands in front of body, arms extended)

Swiftly clap them. One, two, three!
(Clap, clap, clap)

Watch

Teddy Bear

Try This

Together, go outside and jump rope or do jumping jacks. Sing songs or rhymes as you jump. Little ones can jump in place.

item.title: July 2
item.description:
Sing a Song

A Sailor Went to Sea, Sea, Sea

A sailor went to sea, sea, sea
To see what he could see, see, see.
But all that he could see, see, see
Was the bottom of the deep blue sea, sea, sea.

item.title: July 1
item.description:
Sing a Song

I Saw You

I saw you in the ocean,
I saw you in the sea,
I saw you in the bathtub,
Oops! Pardon me.
